Fields.DialogueText: Hey, Captain! What are you up to?
Just surveying our plan of attack, why?
Well, I've been collecting some precious stones here and there in port. I made this for you!

Fields.MenuText: Thanks, Narwhal, it's gorgeous!
Wow, Narwhal, you didn't have to make anything for me.
Err, what is it?

Fields.DialogueText: I made this jewelry special for the whole crew.
We're comrades, Captain, so of course I have to get you something!
It's jewelry, can't you tell?
Oh, wow, Narwhal. Thank you.
Why don't you try it on?
I guess I will... how does it look?
Perfect! I just hope it doesn't get in the way when we fight the Morganas.
*ALARM*
Well, according to the radar, that's going to happen sooner rather than later.
@BATTLE
Watch your jewelry, Captain. We've got company!
@BATTLE
Well, that could have ended a little better.
Narwhal, we could use at least one day without sarcasm.
Someone's got to keep us in high spirits!
Sigh... Narwhal, can you...

Fields.MenuText: Go clean the ship up a bit?
Check for damage?
Go bother someone else?

Fields.DialogueText: Aye, aye...
Damage? Oh, of course! I'll start with the personal quarters.
Sorry, Captain... I'll leave you be.
Unless you actually have anything better to do.
We could always go plan a Morgana attack!
Now? We just had a big battle! Let's reconnect soon.
If you say so, but like a string to a hook, I'll reel you in, Captain!
Maybe we can use you as bait!
Hey!
So, Narwhal, what's the status on our supply report?
Uh, what report?
I asked you to work on a supply report. We may not be docking for anything but battles for a while.
Uh-huh. And when did you issue said report?

Fields.MenuText: Last night, pretty late.
Just this morning.
Hmm... actually, I don't remember.

Fields.DialogueText: It could be possible I was sleeping, or maybe sleepwalking. I do that.
Oh, well, you should know not to give me any orders until after breakfast. Just saying.
Could this be one of the Captain's infamous "pretend to give orders" moments? You're getting forgetful in your age!
Ugh... it doesn't matter. Narwhal, just see to it we have a supply checklist.
Yes, Captain! I'll put it at the top of my to-do list!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
...Second from the top!
Captain, I've got that supply report you assigned!
@BATTLE
Yeesh, two big battles in a row! Talk about monotony.
Are you safe? Is anyone hurt?
No, I think we're fine.

Fields.MenuText: Good, that's a relief.
If anything happened to you, Narwhal, our ship would be in trouble.
I was worried about you, Narwhal. I thought I felt some pretty serious impacts, so I can only imagine how you feel.

Fields.DialogueText: I mean, we were hit pretty hard, but I'm made of some pretty strong stuff!
Captain, I'd feel the same way if you were hurt as well.
Hey! I'm way tougher than I look, I can tell you that.
And I don't doubt any of that. Anyways, let's--
Well... there's just one thing. The stateroom was unlocked.
You mean--?
When we were hit, everything fell. They're all damaged. I'm so sorry, Captain.
Excellent. Good to have everything in order-
*ALARM*
-Before just such an occasion.
Damage report, then. At least we've got that supply report to refer to.
What's the damage report?
Well, it's not as bad as I thought. A lot of my stuff from previous expeditions are broken, but that's life.

Fields.MenuText: We will replace them.
It happens, unfortunately.
I would be a lot more upset if that had happened to me.

Fields.DialogueText: But some of these are irreplaceable!
Yeah, things break in life. We take the broken pieces with us.
Well, I'm a little bit different than you, Captain.
Did anything survive?
Well, there's a few things... but I found something I haven't noticed before in the rubble. A bottle!
What do you mean?
There's a message in it, too. Should we read it?
*BOOM*
I think that's going to have to wait a bit!
@BATTLE
All right, let's see what we've got in here...
@BATTLE
Narwhal, are you still here?
Aye, Captain.
Do you still have the message? Can we read it?
Yeah, give me a moment to open it up... There! Finally... Huh? It's not a message. It's a map!

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like an adventure in the making!
Hmm... Could this be for buried treasure...?
Better watch out. It could be related to the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Should we follow it? Hmm...
Well, yo-ho-ho, a pirate's life for me!
Now, Captain, not everything is related to the Morganas.
Let's put it away for now. There's nothing to see here.
Well this big "X" is quite suspicious! Wonder what it stands for... eXtravagant? EXciting?
EXhausting?
Damn, this is sealed really tight. I've half a mind to-
Don't break it. These Morganas are going to make enough of a mess.
Oh, you're no fun!
Hey, Captain, look! There's a rock formation sticking out of the water. Isn't that cool?
Yes, Narwhal. I can see that.
Now, why does it look so familiar...?
I have no idea.
Oh, but isn't it beautiful?

Fields.MenuText: Well, it's certainly a feat of natural wonder.
It's more interesting than beautiful, no? How do the rocks stick up like that?
Eh, I don't care much for this kind of thing.

Fields.DialogueText: It's petrifying, right? Heh, get it?
I don't know how things like that are made, honestly.
Oh, really? Well, I happen to care a lot for this type of thing!
Hmm... Now that you do mention it, this rock formation does look familiar, somehow...
...Oh! Wait right here!
*ALARM*
Where are you going? We have a battle to fight!
@BATTLE
Belle, remember? I'll teleport right back when I find it!
There you are, Captain!
Whoa! Slow down, Narwhal.
Look at the map!
Give me a second, Narwhal, I'm--
Take a look!
All right, all right...
See the rocks? This is it, it's right here! Now, don't you think we're near some kind of mystery?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know about mystery, but it certainly is the landmark on the map!
What does the map say it leads to? Is there a path?
It doesn't look like anything to me.

Fields.DialogueText: So I'd assume that everything else along the way is accurate.
Well, not an exact path, but there's certainly a goal in sight!
Really? Look, there's clearly a path right there, just like on the map!
Now then, I guess we know which way to go for an adventure, and what direction to take!
@BATTLE
I knew it was a real treasure map! Look, there's even sea monsters!
*ALARM*
So, what's the next landmark on the map?
Well, it says here there's supposed to be an island that sort of looks like a skull from one side. Pretty morbid, eh?
How would we find that?
I'm not certain. Where should we chart a course for?

Fields.MenuText: We should go straight ahead, like the map suggests.
We should talk to the navigator and see what our plans should be.
Let's go by our own route!

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe we'll run right into the skull island!
I'll go wire him through and we'll have a little chat!
Well, whatever you say! You're the captain, of course!
I just hope the Morganas don't find it first...
What was that?
I said, let's prepare for the next battle with the Morganas, yeah!
@BATTLE
Narwhal, refresh me. What's the endgame here?
Hey, I'm just trying to eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner, while also not geting blown up by spooky ghost ships.
Uh, no, I meant on the map. Can you lift it up to the light?
Oh! Well, you can see that there's an "X" here, and I think that means something special.
Wait, what's that on the back of the map?
Whoa, there's a back! It says:
"From pale flesh and ruby eyes..."
"To the soulless depths of navy blue..."
"The enraptured treasure of world skies..."
"Search for what's endlessly true."
What do you think it means?

Fields.MenuText: It sounds very ominous...
It sounds like a challenge!
I have no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: It's dark. Like, half past midnight dark.
A challenge? Yes, to find the "X" - of course!
Hmm, I guess we're going to find out...
While I'm intrigued, I'm just looking forward to when we finally get done with all this Morgana craziness.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Me too, Captain. Imagine what we could find without them to disturb us!
The more I think about it, the more it seems very peculiar that this map hasn't been discovered before.
Well, it's a big ocean. "Swallow you whole" and all that, you know.
Huh?
Why don't you take a closer look at it?

Fields.MenuText: Wow, this map seems very old!
This handwriting is strange, as if it was written by some long-lost group.
It looks authentic. This is ancient history, for sure.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm honestly surprised it doesn't just dissolve! The paper is so thin...
Don't be silly, Captain. It's probably nothing... I think.
Well, yeah, it's old, of course!
And where did you find this?
I found it a while back, when I was just floating around.
Hmm...
Look out there! That island... oh, it's definitely a skull!
That's not all. See that shadow by the cove? It looks like someone's been waiting for us. Get ready!
@BATTLE
How did they know we were there? It was like the Morganas knew we were coming.
Well, we are in a war, Captain. There are enemies anywhere and everywhere.
I want to know why we couldn't sense them earlier...
Well, according to the crew, they didn't show up on the radar... Do you think there's something weird about this island?

Fields.MenuText: It could be. We're in a very strange place at the edge of the ocean, that's for sure.
I have no idea. We'll have to provide more research to make sure.
No, it's probably just a mistake on our end.

Fields.DialogueText: We're going to need to be on extra-special guard, then!
We're working on it, and I think I'll meet with the radar group to make sure.
Well, I hope it doesn't happen again...
I mean, we are passing a skull... it's a little spooky.
Here's hoping it gets easier.
*ALARM*
Not with these Morganas, it won't...
@BATTLE
Let's see... if we've been following these landmarks correctly, our course should take us...
@BATTLE
Narwhal, what's next on the map?
Uhh, we passed the spiky rocks, and then the island that looks like a skull from one side. Uhh, now it's just water.
What do you mean, water?
Take a look at this.
Hmm, you're right. It looks like a bunch of drawings of waves on paper. I suppose it could mean danger, so we should watch out.
I think it means something like... rocky waters? Who knows.
Anyway, we should keep our eyes out.
Command called the other day, asking about our positions. What should we say?

Fields.MenuText: Well, we've been fighting the Morganas. Be honest. Say we've been successful and we've been fighting hard, despite being a little off course.
Tell them we'll turn back once we investigate this island.
We lie. We'll tell them we'll be returning soon, but this is a straight press forward.

Fields.DialogueText: We certainly have been fighting hard, Captain. I'm sure they'll reward us for our good work.
I'm glad I've got you hooked on this adventure, Captain!
Lying, for this? Well, it's your call, Captain. I just hope this is all worth it.
All right. Now, let's press onward before more Morganas track our position.
*ALARM*
...Right across these Morganas' path.
Well, that certainly wasn't marked!
Captain, the water is getting choppier.
Hmm, could it be a problem with what's underwater? Narwhal, can you take a look?
Sure thing, Captain!
Wow, it's stormy out, too. Rocking the ship...
Wow, Narwhal, that was quick. How did it look?
It's not good. Ships, everywhere. Countless wrecks in the ocean, all around. And not a single fish in sight!

Fields.MenuText: That's... terrifying, to say the least.
All of those poor sailors who've come here before...
Damn it... We know who to blame here!

Fields.DialogueText: It was bad, Captain. If I were you, I think I'd want to turn back, or at least proceed with extra caution.
That's the strange thing, Captain. There was no sign of life, or anything.
We can blame the Morganas all we want, but we're still their next targets.
I had a feeling...
Do you think the Morganas are the ones who wrote this map?
Maybe. Maybe.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
If only we could interrogate one...
That's something I don't even want to imagine.
Shooting to kill, then!
Narwhal, what are you doing? It's still a mess in here...
I'm just looking back at these broken trinkets. We've just been so busy, that I haven't been able to set aside time to repair them.

Fields.MenuText: Narwhal, how are you doing?
Narwhal, I'm worried about you.
Well, do you need any help?

Fields.DialogueText: It's all just so stressful. I liked my treasures. It was my personal collection... Have you ever lost a collection before?
Captain, I swear, I'll be good in battle. It's only my personal life that we have to worry about, ha ha...
Captain, that's awfully nice, but I'm not going to be a burden on you.
Just remember, as your captain, and as your friend, I'm here for you.
You know... I really appreciate that, Captain. It's just slow work, especially since the boat's been shaking back and forth a lot.
Back and forth?
Yes. I think we may be in trouble soon...
*ALARM*
Better get to the bridge. I think we're about to have a fight on our hands.
@BATTLE
So it seems the next stop on the map, Captain, is a bird.
A bird? What does that mean?
I think it means we'll be seeing a lot of birds soon... or maybe one really big bird.
You mean like those?
Oh, wow! That's a blue-crested albatross! And a flock of herons!

Fields.MenuText: How do you know so much about birds?
They are rather good-looking, aren't they? All those colors...
Well, I'm honestly not much for birds. I suppose it's not common to see them here, though, if it's specially marked on the map.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... I made those up. I really don't know much about birds. They're probably pigeons or something...
Yes, but they would look better on my plate!
That's a good theory, Captain!
Well, whatever they are, we're getting near whatever this "bird" thing is, I guess.
Maybe it's a bird paradise, like an island where birds walk around like humans, drinking tea and listening to bird music!
Bird music?
Like, ca-caw! But, you know, to tunes.
Let's move along now. I think we'll be quite fine.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're going to have to earn it, Captain!
Captain, we're passing by the island, so look out for the droppings!
Droppings? What droppings?
What just fell on my head?!
Ha ha ha! That would be a dropping, Captain.
Yuck! I'm going to go change, but please clean this up in the meantime...
Oh, all right.
Oh, this is rather gross...
All right, I'm back. Gosh, there are a lot of birds around here.

Fields.MenuText: Where do they all seem to come from?
Do you think the Morganas have anything to do with this?
I really hate birds. I'm more of an fish person, myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Over on some island. Maybe they don't have natural predators, or maybe they-- uh, actually, you don't care, do you? Forget it.
I don't know, but Morganas seem attracted to all sorts of strange things. It wouldn't be a stretch.
Well, as a sailor, I wouldn't have guessed!
Well, while I was out, it seems we noticed some Morganas waiting for us on the horizon. So let's get to action stations!
@BATTLE
*SPLAT*
Ugh, it still smells funny on the ship. Damn birds...
Honestly, once you get used to it, it's not so bad.
Well, I'm just glad we're past that bird place. How much more is on the map?
Well... just the "X" and nothing else.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think we're going to find there?
We must be pretty close. How should we proceed?
I can't wait to get this over with and find out what the "X" really is.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know, I'm just excited to find out! Oh, I hope it's worth it!
Well, we should probably make a plan of attack against the Morganas we'll inevitably face.
Well, we still have a long, long way to go.
Regardless, it looks like we've got some big goals left to finish.
I just know the Morganas are out there, waiting for us to strike!
You're probably right. I hope we have a safe passage, but judging by the past, it'll only get more and more difficult from here.
@BATTLE
Looks like you're not far off the mark. Ready up!
Captain, do you see that in the distance? I think that's the island! The "X"!
Really? ... It seems too soon.
Well, that's gotta be it. Shall we send a scout to check it out?
Yes. See if you can scare up a seaplane to investigate, and we'll await their signal.
Now, what do you think is there? Be honest.

Fields.MenuText: Treasure, of course!
Some sort of ancient artifacts with vast cultural importance.
Eh, probably nothing too interesting.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, then we'll absolutely have a replenished stockpile of materials for the ones that got broken!
I wonder if it's left behind by the same people who drew the map, or if it's something even bigger...
Wha-- Nothing? How could this be for nothing!?
*STATIC*
The radio! Stand by to copy the scout's reconnaissance report, Captain.
Got it... Roger... What's that? Say again? Copy all.
Why's that?
*ALARM*
That isn't an island, Narwhal. It's an enemy ship-- the Morganas are here.
Oh, no...
@BATTLE
Narwhal, get everyone together and sound the alarm.
Awright, action stations, everyone! We've got BIG fish to fry!
@BATTLE
Narwhal! Damage report?
Well, I think we're fine... but that seaplane is nowhere to be found.
A shame... but we made the Morganas pay tenfold!
We did!

Fields.MenuText: Sigh... was this this all for nothing? Did we accomplish naught but to risk the lives of good people?
Was that the whole "X" idea? A big trap?
I don't know what to say, Narwhal. What do we do? We're in too deep now...

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know, Captain. It's been a long, hard-fought journey, but it wasn't for nothing.
We don't know if it's only a trap, or if there was something else. I'll do my best to find out.
Captain, you're in charge - we need you to be confident. Don't give up now!
Sorry, Narwhal, I'm just feeling rather discouraged right now...
Roger, Captain. I'll leave you alone for a little while...
No, Narwhal, you don't have to. I'm glad you're here, and not just for our battles.
You've always been the one to stay positive and cheer us on, and even though it's difficult, I'll do my best to return the favor.
That's my captain! I knew you'd do the same for me.
Captain, I know it's difficult, but the war isn't over.
What are we looking for? Suppose there's no big secret, nothing to find but endless Morganas. An enemy we can't even seem to really defeat.
Well, come look at this. We found it floating in the wreckage after the last battle.
What is it?
It's another message in a bottle, strangely enough. Should we open it?
No. Leave it there.
Huh? Why not?

Fields.MenuText: It's not ours for the taking.
If anything, we should put it in the stateroom, with our treasures... as a reminder.
I feel we've had more than enough trouble with messages in bottles.

Fields.DialogueText: We should at least hold onto it, then.
Hmm, that would be nice.
I suppose you're right. We already have enough trouble on our hands from the war...
Let's get going, Narwhal. It's time to get back to our patriotic duty.
@BATTLE
Along this course, I'm sure we'll be dealing with Morgana patrols before you know it, Captain!
*ALARM*
Damn it, I didn't mean right now!
Captain, come float with me!
Narwhal, are you overboard!? Why?
It's really relaxing to lay out in the sun like this!

Fields.MenuText: Narwhal, do you think this is appropriate?
Is the water warm, at least?
Okay, okay, I'll come join you in a few. I'm busy right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, maybe not, but we earned it.
Of course, Captain! We're in temperate waters!
Busy, busy, busy! Come on.
Oh, all right. Here I come!
Mmmm, you're right. This is rather nice...
Well, we may have to leave soon... You feel the water cooling down?
I thought that was you.
*ALARM*
Nope. Definitely Morganas. Let's get back on board.
And I'd just gotten in!
@BATTLE
We've got a lot of victories against the Morganas under our belts. It gives me hope for the future.
Yet they still keep coming, and the war rages on... Captain, what's on your mind?

Fields.MenuText: I think we bit off more than we could chew with the map. I'm worried about doing that again.
I think we lost sight of our original mission, and I'm ashamed of the cost we paid for it.
What should we do with ourselves now that the battle is done?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it was sad, and disappointing in some ways, but in the end we went on such a great adventure!
It is a somber reminder, but we must take it in stride and look to the future!
Well, we go fight the war, of course. We'll wait until the next adventure.
Well, you're right. I think it's time to move on.
Oooh, can I say it?
You know what? Go for it.
SET THE SAILS!
Narwhal, we don't have sails.
Right, um, I was just testing you! ACTION STATIONS!
@BATTLE
Remember the island of birds?
Remember those rock formations?
How about that skull island?
Thinking back on it, it didn't really even look like a skull!
You're right, it didn't!
Which did you like the most?

Fields.MenuText: The birds.
The stone pillars.
The "skull" island.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha ha, really? One pooped on you!
I liked those the most. I wish I had the chance to dive down and see how far they really went.
Yeah, it was kinda weird, though. I wonder who first thought it was a skull!
I suppose we had some good times, didn't we?
And I wouldn't say they're over just yet!
We've got a knack for finding those, you know?
Even when they're not where we expect them to be. The best ones rarely are, I find. Nothing like a good surprise!
Let's go give one to the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Captain! I made this for you!
What is this?
So I kept all those broken treasures and shells from the stateroom... and I went ahead and made more jewelry with it!

Fields.MenuText: What are those green, reflective bits made from?
This is amazing handiwork... Where did you learn to shape metal like this?
I suppose this means you'll be on the lookout for even more treasures to fill up those shelves!

Fields.DialogueText: I used the glass from the map's bottle!
A Belle never reveals her secrets!
Ha ha, you know it, Captain!
And, oh, there's this. It's a locket!
Oh... and what's inside?
It's from the map. I cut out your favorite place, and now you can keep it forever!
This is great, Narwhal. Thank you.
I like the idea of broken treasures. There's something about all these little pieces...
Kind of like us, in a way.
Yeah... like us.
And we, too, are going to change and grow and become even more brilliant, from here on out!
They aren't perfect, but they're still brilliant... and they wouldn't be the way they are without going through all the changes and troubles that brought them here.
Well, heat tempers steel. Looks like we're not out of the woods quite yet.
Time to cut a path!
